item.title: Developer Claims Ethereum is Stolen Intellectual Property, Files Complaints with FBI
item.description:
Developer Claims Ethereum is Stolen Intellectual Property, Files Complaints with FBI

After claiming he'd filed formal complaints with the FBI, the man who alleged that Ethereum is his stolen intellectual property says he is making his first attempt to contact the media about the theft. Although Vitalik Buterin is the identified brain behind the Ethereum project which has gained notoriety especially for its smart contract feature, Jared Mimms claims that Buterin stole his idea.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Consolidating At $640
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Consolidating At $640

Bitcoin price has spent another day in the vicinity of its consolidation pivot level of $640 (Bitstamp). Consolidation leads to break-out, but traders are advised to mind the possibility of a fake-out. This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay. Read the full analysis here. Not a member?

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Patience, Patience... - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Patience, Patience... - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this evening. Our analysis of the bitcoin price on an intraday basis is becoming relatively monotonous. We define a range in the morning, look to trade that range throughout the session that follows, be that intrarange or on a breakout strategy, and then evaluate the day's trading come evening time.

item.title: Nation State 'Increasingly Irrelevant' for Blockchain Startups, Study Finds
item.description:
Nation State 'Increasingly Irrelevant' for Blockchain Startups, Study Finds

Startup networker Blockchain Angels' analysis highlights the US as "heavily invested in Bitcoin" amid the overall "increasing irrelevance of the nation state" for Blockchain businesses. Also read: Bitcoin Startup Among First Finalists in New PayPal Incubator The findings, posted by parent company Outlier Ventures' head of research and partnerships Lawrence Lundy last week, sought to make sense of the current blockchain startup landscape and the direction it may be heading.

item.title: Blockchain Innovation Announces the Release of the Simple, Fast, and Secure BitTeller ATM - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Blockchain Innovation Announces the Release of the Simple, Fast, and Secure BitTeller ATM - Bitcoin News

Disclaimer: Bitcoin.com does not endorse nor support this product, use at your own risk. This is a Press Release. Submit yours today here! The World's Most Affordable Bitcoin ATM Austin, Texas (July 7) - Blockchain Innovation, announced today the official release of their highly anticipated Bitcoin ATM, the BitTeller.

item.title: IRC meeting summary for 2016-07-07
item.description:
IRC meeting summary for 2016-07-07

Gmaxwell notes he'd still like to see separate testnet-defaulting binaries during the RC's. Wumpus points at a PR he missed that makes it very easy to install a testnet client. 0.13.0 rc1 & HD wallet issue FIBRE announcement The Bitcoin Core team is working towards 0.13.0 RC1.

item.title: Belgium Regulators Issue Warning About OneCoin Investment Scheme - CoinDesk
item.description:
Belgium Regulators Issue Warning About OneCoin Investment Scheme - CoinDesk

A top financial regulator in Belgium has issued a warning about OneCoin, a digital currency product that has frequently drawn fraud accusations. The notice, published this weekend, states that remarks from promoters that OneCoin has received the institution's tacit approval are "false and misleading".

item.title: Beginner's Guide to Ethereum Mining - How to Mine Ethereum on Your PC?
item.description:
Beginner's Guide to Ethereum Mining - How to Mine Ethereum on Your PC?

If you're new to mining Ethereum, this guide covers all the important facts in a simple, low-jargon way. Let's start with some short answers to common questions about Ethereum mining: Q: Why should I mine Ethereum tokens (aka ether or ETH)? doesn't mining Ether take up a lot of electricity?

item.title: Bitcoin Beyond Nerds: How to Get the Average Joe to Use Cryptocurrency
item.description:
Bitcoin Beyond Nerds: How to Get the Average Joe to Use Cryptocurrency

Bitcoin is still seen as the tech nerd's plaything rather than the everyman's money. Four cryptocurrency adoption experts share their tips and tricks for how to bring crypto to the average Joe. A 2013 report found that the vast majority of Bitcoin users were male, libertarian, non-religious, and used their coins for donations rather than illegal activity.
